title: 'Indecent': Macron's awkward embrace with sports minister at Paris Olympics raises eyebrows
content: Photos of French President Emmanuel Macron and Sports Minister Amélie Oudéa-Castéra sharing an affectionate moment at the 2024 Paris Olympics opening ceremony have sparked online debate. The incident, highlighted by Madame Figaro magazine, drew mixed reactions, with some critics disapproving of the public display of affection.
summary: Photos of French President Emmanuel Macron and Sports Minister Amélie Oudéa-Castéra sharing an affectionate moment at the 2024 Paris Olympics opening ceremony have sparked online debate. The incident, highlighted by Madame Figaro magazine, drew mixed reactions, with some critics disapproving of the public display of affection.

title: Hundreds of China merchants join protest against Temu
content: This week, hundreds of merchants protested at the offices of PDD Holdings Inc in southern China, accusing the owner of the Temu platform of imposing unfair penalties. The suppliers, primarily small businesses selling Chinese goods to Western consumers via Temu, gathered outside the company's Guangzhou office on Monday. They held placards and chanted slogans, with some entering the offices, though they dispersed without meeting senior executives.
summary: This week, hundreds of merchants protested at the offices of PDD Holdings Inc in southern China, accusing the owner of the Temu platform of imposing unfair penalties. The suppliers, primarily small businesses selling Chinese goods to Western consumers via Temu, gathered outside the company's Guangzhou office on Monday. They held placards and chanted slogans, with some entering the offices, though they dispersed without meeting senior executives.

title: Why this Brazilian Olympic surfer's pose has gone viral
content: Gabriel Medina's incredible wave ride in Tahiti, skillfully captured by AFP's Jerome Brouillet, has become an iconic image of surfing and the 2024 Paris Olympics. The photograph showcases Medina's triumphant exit from the wave with a record Olympic score, rapidly gaining global attention and millions of shares online.
summary: Gabriel Medina's incredible wave ride in Tahiti, skillfully captured by AFP's Jerome Brouillet, has become an iconic image of surfing and the 2024 Paris Olympics. The photograph showcases Medina's triumphant exit from the wave with a record Olympic score, rapidly gaining global attention and millions of shares online.

title: Kamala Harris to hold first rally with VP pick in crucial Philadelphia, say sources
Kamala Harris unveils $50m 'Fearless' ad campaign, targeting Trump
content: US vice president Kamala Harris launched a $50 million ad campaign with a one-minute spot titled “Fearless” after consolidating support post-Biden's withdrawal and endorsement. The campaign targets key battleground states and young voters, focusing on Donald Trump's felony convictions and anti-abortion measures, aiming to close the polling gap with her rival.
summary: US vice president  Kamala Harris launched a $50 million ad campaign with a one-minute spot titled “Fearless” after consolidating support post-Biden's withdrawal and endorsement. The campaign targets key battleground states and young voters, focusing on Donald Trump's felony convictions and anti-abortion measures, aiming to close the polling gap with her rival.

title: Kamala Harris's 'weird' campaign strategy: How Democrats are trying to make Trump laughingstock
'White dudes for Harris' raise over $4 million, discuss women's rights
content: A live video call urging white men to support Kamala Harris raised $4 million with over 190,000 participants, featuring celebrities like Mark Hamill and Josh Groban. Organized by Ross Morales Rocketto of 'Run for Something,' the event focused on the importance of white male votes in the upcoming election against Donald Trump.
summary: A live video call urging white men to support Kamala Harris raised $4 million with over 190,000 participants, featuring celebrities like Mark Hamill and Josh Groban. Organized by Ross Morales Rocketto of 'Run for Something,' the event focused on the importance of white male votes in the upcoming election against Donald Trump.

title: 'Say it to my face': Kamala Harris taunts Donald Trump at Atlanta Rally, energizes supporters ahead of 2024 US election
First US air strike in Iraq since February targets drone threat, leaves four dead
Raging California wildfire swells to over 600 square miles, bigger than city of Los Angeles
Wildfire near Colorado city expands to over 1,800 acres, triggers mandatory evacuations
Chicken-or-egg riddle leads to murder in Indonesia; suspect arrested
El Chapo's son faces trial: Guzman Lopez pleads not guilty to drug trafficking charges
Donald Trump says Kamala Harris doesn't like Jewish people, agrees her husband is 'crappy Jew'
content: ​Kamala Harris' husband Douglas Emhoff is a Jew and the first Jewish spouse of an American vice president. But Donald Trump said Kamala Harris does not like Jewish people notwithstanding the fact that she is married to one. In an interview on WABC radio Tuesday, Trump said Harris dislikes Jews and Israel more than Biden.
summary: ​Kamala Harris' husband Douglas Emhoff is a Jew and the first Jewish spouse of an American vice president. But Donald Trump said Kamala Harris does not like Jewish people notwithstanding the fact that she is married to one. In an interview on WABC radio Tuesday, Trump said Harris dislikes Jews and Israel more than Biden.

title: 'Go after Meta and Google': Trump reacts to censorship on assassination content
content: Former president Donald Trump Tuesday reacted to the reported censorship on content on the assassination bid on him by Meta and Google. Social media users pointed out that that Facebook was labeling the image of Donald Trump pumping his fist in the air after the assassination bid in Pennsylvania as an "altered photo". Meta Public Affairs director Dani Lever admitted that it was an error triggered by a separate version of the image.
summary: Former president Donald Trump Tuesday reacted to the reported censorship on content on the assassination bid on him by Meta and Google. Social media users pointed out that that Facebook was labeling the image of Donald Trump pumping his fist in the air after the assassination bid in Pennsylvania as an "altered photo". Meta Public Affairs director Dani Lever admitted that it was an error triggered by a separate version of the image.

title: 'Our last chance': Venezuelan youth weigh leaving after election result
content: University graduate Jorge Salcedo sees no future in Venezuela after President Nicolas Maduro's contested re-election. Salcedo, disheartened by alleged electoral fraud and violence between supporters, considers joining the millions who have already left the country amid its economic and political turmoil. He fears that the young generation will continue to emigrate if the regime persists.
summary: University graduate Jorge Salcedo sees no future in Venezuela after President Nicolas Maduro's contested re-election. Salcedo, disheartened by alleged electoral fraud and violence between supporters, considers joining the millions who have already left the country amid its economic and political turmoil. He fears that the young generation will continue to emigrate if the regime persists.

title: Actor 'shocked' seeing grocery store in Africa. 'I was lied to,' she says after backlash
content: Comedian Tiffany Haddish has been slammed for a viral TikTok video in which she is seen expressing shock that Africa has grocery stores. Now she has defended her viral video and said she was showing it to the world that they were taught wrong things about Africa.
summary: Comedian Tiffany Haddish has been slammed for a viral TikTok video in which she is seen expressing shock that Africa has grocery stores. Now she has defended her viral video and said she was showing it to the world that they were taught wrong things about Africa.

title: How El Chapo's son helped US capture 'last godfather' of Sinaloa drug cartel
content: Ismael Zambada Garcia, a top figure in Mexico's Sinaloa cartel, was captured after being lured into a meeting by Joaquin Guzman Lopez, son of El Chapo. Guzman Lopez allegedly abducted him, leading to a clash between their bodyguards. US authorities were not involved in the covert operation but later apprehended Garcia upon his arrival in the US.
summary: Ismael Zambada Garcia, a top figure in Mexico's Sinaloa cartel, was captured after being lured into a meeting by Joaquin Guzman Lopez, son of El Chapo. Guzman Lopez allegedly abducted him, leading to a clash between their bodyguards. US authorities were not involved in the covert operation but later apprehended Garcia upon his arrival in the US.

title: 'BRAT' meme fest puts Kamala in lime-light
content: Kamala Harris's unexpected run for US president sparked a surge of memes centered on Charli XCX's new album, BRAT. The campaign, infused with the album's lime green aesthetic, quickly gained popularity after Charli XCX declared 'Kamala IS brat.
summary: Kamala Harris's unexpected run for US president sparked a surge of memes centered on Charli XCX's new album, BRAT. The campaign, infused with the album's lime green aesthetic, quickly gained popularity after Charli XCX declared 'Kamala IS brat.

title: When JD Vance wrote he felt more like a female
content: ​Ohio senator and Donald Trump's running mate JD Vance has one after another firefighting to do as there's no end to the skeletons tumbling out of the closet. First the rumor that he had sex with a couch, then his Mountain Dew comment followed by resurfacing of his past 'childless cat ladies' comment, then his email exchange with a friend where he slammed Trump and now his Venmo account which was left public and now his digital footprints lead us back to some weird blogs.
summary: ​Ohio senator and Donald Trump's running mate JD Vance has one after another firefighting to do as there's no end to the skeletons tumbling out of the closet. First the rumor that he had sex with a couch, then his Mountain Dew comment followed by resurfacing of his past 'childless cat ladies' comment, then his email exchange with a friend where he slammed Trump and now his Venmo account which was left public and now his digital footprints lead us back to some weird blogs.
